thread.title: Hohenfels wins fourth straight with KO of Vicenza
thread.title_full: Hohenfels wins fourth straight with KO of Vicenza

title: Hohenfels wins fourth straight with KO of Vicenza
text:
Hohenfels wins fourth straight with KO of Vicenza Vicenza page 
HOHENFELS, Germany -- The Hohenfels Tigers will take a four-game winning streak into the DODDS-Europe Division II playoffs. 
The host Tigers blasted the Vicenza Cougars 48-13 on Saturday, securing the No. 4 seed and home-field advantage in next weekend's quarterfinal round. The Tigers will take on No. 5 SHAPE. The loss eliminates Vicenza, a 2014 semifinalist, from playoff contention with a 1-4 record on the season. 
Jordan Kelly ran for 179 yards and two touchdowns and Tony Saintmelus ran for 118 yards and two touchdowns to spearhead the Tiger offense. 
Trey Briscoe returned an interception 78 yards for a defensive touchdown, while Andrew Chavez and Connor GIbson each recorded three sacks for the Tigers. Hohenfels, the 2013 Division II champion and 2014 runner-up, has won each of its last four games by at least 20 points since opening the season with a loss to Bitburg.
